text: today's recipe is so simple you won't
believe how delicious results are it's
eight flourless chocolate torte and it
was originally created by our friend and
colleague John baricelli and he did it
on our old everyday food show and I
loved it so much that I wanted to do it
on this video for you guys so what you
need to do is melt 1 pound of really
high-quality semi-sweet chocolate that's
what I'm doing here doing it over a pan
of simmering water but you can do it in
the microwave if you wanted to the key
you when you're melting chocolate over a
water bath like this is not to have the
bottom of the bowl touching the
simmering water so it doesn't scorch and
it just melts over a nice even heat and
what I like to do is take it off when
it's almost completely melted but not
completely melted especially if you need
your chocolate to be sort of a room
temperature when you're using it like
you do for this recipe so I can see that
there's a very few lumps left I'm just
gonna take it off the heat the carryover
cooking will continue to melt the
chocolate these six eggs need to be
beaten with two tablespoons of sugar two
tablespoons of dark rum you could use a
light rum if you wanted to but this has
a little bit more of a pronounced flavor
and a half a teaspoon of salt you want
to get it really light and fluffy so
that it folds the ribbon I'll show you
what I mean when we get to that point
so this is like tripled in volume and
it's very very light and fluffy when you
lift the beater it should hold a ribbon
on the surface for a few seconds before
sinking into the rest of the eggs so
that's when you know they're ready now
what you want to do is fold this into
the cooled chocolate master in order to
keep the lightness as much as possible
you want to start with about half the
mixture so half the egg mixture into the
chocolate you can stir it at this point
this is that lightening period you just
sort of stir it up and then you fold in
the remaining you also want to add to
this mixture one cup of whipped cream or
a half a cup of heavy cream that's been
whipped fold till everything is nicely
combined have your oven preheating to
350 degrees okay let me show you what
this is I have a roasting pan and then I
have a 9-inch springform pan that I have
buttered and lined with parchment paper
and then wrapped with foil the foil just
ensures that there will be no water
leaking into the pan one more thing is
that I've put the bottom in what you
might consider upside down so the ridge
part is down that makes it easier to
remove the cake at the end now pour your
cake batter into the pan show you again
at all it's so much chocolate in here
you don't want to waste that smooth at
the top and then have some water boiling
because you need to make a water bath so
this cooks nice and gently you just pour
the boiling water into the pan should
come about halfway up the sides of the
pan you're just one of the bed in the
oven until it's firm to the touch it'll
take about 30 minutes and then you take
it out cool it on a rack for a little
while and then pop it in the
refrigerator to get nice and cold okay
chilled and ready to go so this doesn't
rise and get all puffy and crackly like
some of the flourless chocolate cakes
you might have had it's a really rich
dense torte right up my alley this is
actually my preferred kind of flourless
chocolate cake so you want to cut this
into slices using a warm knife but it
shouldn't be wet so wipe it off between
slices and then cut it's very rich so
you only need thin slices yummy guys
take a little slice little dollop of
cream and you're good to go all right
I'm good to go you've got to go out and
get these six ingredients and make this
cake you are going to love it it's like
eating a trumpet you're not gonna
believe it
